; <L>28747<pc>165,1<k1>iti
; <ls>  
102386 old <div n="p"/><s>i/ti</s> may form an adverbial compound with the name of an author (<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>i/ti-pARini</s>, thus according to <s1 slp1="pARini">Pāṇini</s1>). It may also express the act of calling attention (lo! behold!) It may have some other significations <ab>e.g.</ab> something additional (as in <s>i/tyAdi</s>, et caetera), order, arrangement specific or distinctive, and identity. It is used by native commentators after quoting a rule to express ‘according to such a rule’ (<ab>e.g.</ab> <s>anudAttaNita i/ty Atmanepadam Bavati</s>, according to the rule of <s1 slp1="pARini">Pāṇini</s1>, <ls> i, 3, 12</ls>, the <s1 slp1="Atmane-pada">Ātmane-pada</s1> takes place).
